==Events==
*  [[81]] &ndash; [[Domitian]] becomes Emperor of the [[Roman Empire]] upon the death of his brother [[Titus]].
* [[629]] &ndash; Emperor [[Heraclius]] enters [[Constantinople]] in triumph after his victory over the [[Sassanid Empire|Persian Empire]].
* [[786]] &ndash; "Night of the three Caliphs": [[Harun al-Rashid]] becomes the [[Abbasid]] [[caliph]] upon the death of his brother [[al-Hadi]]. Birth of Harun's son [[al-Ma'mun]].
*[[1180]] &ndash; [[Battle of Ishibashiyama]] in Japan.
*[[1607]] &ndash; [[Flight of the Earls]] from Lough Swilly, Donegal, Ireland.
*[[1682]] &ndash; [[Bishop Gore School]], one of the oldest schools in Wales, is founded.
*[[1741]] &ndash; [[George Frideric Handel]] completes his oratorio ''[[Messiah (Handel)|Messiah]]''
*[[1752]] &ndash; The [[British Empire]] adopts the [[Gregorian calendar]], skipping eleven days (the previous day was September 2).
*[[1763]] &ndash; [[Seneca people|Seneca]] warriors defeat British forces at the [[Battle of Devil's Hole]] during [[Pontiac's War]].
*[[1791]] &ndash; The [[Papal States]] lose Avignon to the [[First French Empire|French Empire]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; [[Finnish War]]: Russians defeat the Swedes in the bloody [[Battle of Oravais]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: The French [[Grande Armée]] enters Moscow. The [[Fire of Moscow (1812)|Fire of Moscow]] begins as soon as Russian troops leave the city.
*[[1814]] &ndash; The poem ''Defence of Fort McHenry'' is written by [[Francis Scott Key]]. The poem is later used as the lyrics of [[The Star-Spangled Banner]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; The [[Ottoman Empire]] signs the [[Treaty of Adrianople (1829)|Treaty of Adrianople]] with Russia, thus ending the [[Russo-Turkish War (1828–1829)|Russo-Turkish War]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Jang Bahadur]] and his brothers [[Kot massacre|massacre]] about 40 members of the Nepalese palace court.
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: [[Winfield Scott]] captures Mexico City.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Battle of South Mountain]], part of the [[Maryland Campaign]], is fought.
*[[1901]] &ndash; [[President of the United States]] [[William McKinley]] dies after an [[Assassination of William McKinley|assassination]] attempt on [[September 6]], and is succeeded by [[Theodore Roosevelt]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; Russia is officially proclaimed a [[republic]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The Estonian military boards the Polish submarine {{ship|ORP|Orzeł|1938|6}} in [[Tallinn]], sparking a [[Orzeł incident|diplomatic incident]] that the Soviet Union will later use to justify the annexation of Estonia.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Ip Massacre]]: The [[Military of Hungary|Hungarian Army]], supported by [[Hungarians in Romania|local Hungarians]], kill 158 [[Romanians|Romanian]] civilians in [[Ip, Sălaj]], a village in [[Northern Transylvania]], as part of attempts to [[ethnic cleansing]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: [[Maastricht]] becomes the first Dutch city to be liberated by [[Allies of World War II|allied forces]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; In a [[Totskoye range nuclear tests|top secret nuclear test]], a Soviet [[Tupolev Tu-4|Tu-4 bomber]] drops a 40 [[kiloton]] atomic weapon just north of [[Totskoye]] village.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The first two German post-war [[Mohr rocket|rockets]], designed by the German engineer [[Ernst Mohr]], reach the upper atmosphere.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The Soviet probe ''[[Luna 2]]'' crashes onto the [[Moon]], becoming the first man-made object to reach it.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries ([[OPEC]]) is founded.
*  1960   &ndash; [[Congo Crisis]]: With [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA]] help, [[Mobutu Sese Seko]] seizes power in a military coup, suspending parliament and the constitution.
*[[1969]] &ndash; The US [[Selective Service]] selects September 14 as the First [[Draft lottery (1969)|Draft Lottery]] Date.
*[[1975]] &ndash; The first American saint, [[Elizabeth Ann Seton]], is canonized by [[Pope Paul VI]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[President of Afghanistan|Afghan President]] [[Nur Muhammad Taraki]] is assassinated upon the order of [[Hafizullah Amin]], who becomes the new president.
*[[1982]] &ndash; President-elect of Lebanon, [[Bachir Gemayel]], is assassinated.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Joe Kittinger]] becomes the first person to fly a [[gas balloon]] alone across the Atlantic Ocean.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Penang Bridge]], the longest bridge in Malaysia, connecting the island of [[Penang]] to the mainland, opens to traffic.
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[Toronto Blue Jays]] set a record for the most home runs in a single game, hitting 10 of them.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The Constitutional Court of [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]] declares the breakaway [[Croatian Republic of Herzeg-Bosnia]] to be illegal.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[Major League Baseball]] season is canceled because of a [[1994 Major League Baseball strike|strike]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Body Worlds]] opens in Tokyo, Japan
*[[1998]] &ndash; Telecommunications companies [[MCI Communications]] and [[WorldCom]] complete their $37 billion merger to form [[MCI WorldCom]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Kiribati]], [[Nauru]] and [[Tonga]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Microsoft]] releases [[Windows ME]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; Historic National Prayer Service held at [[Washington National Cathedral]] for victims of the [[September 11, 2001 attacks|September 11 attacks]]. A similar service is held in Canada on [[Parliament Hill]], the largest vigil ever held in the nation's capital.
*[[2003]] &ndash; In a referendum, [[Estonia]] approves joining the [[European Union]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Late-2000s financial crisis]]: The [[Northern Rock]] bank experiences the first [[bank run]] in the United Kingdom in 150 years.
*[[2008]] &ndash; All 88 people on board [[Aeroflot Flight 821]] are killed when the plane crashes on approach to [[Perm Airport]].
